Name: Fifteen Imitation Vases
Description: These 15 dummy vases were found in the tomb of Yuya and Thuya. They are made of wood and terra-cotta but were painted to imitate alabaster, black and white glass, diorite, and red breccia, a type of marble. The vases are variously shaped, ranging from a plain cylindrical vase with projecting rim to a long-necked vase with a round body and long handle. They are coated with white plaster and painted with short red strokes to imitate stone.
